questions.question: Which quotation provides the best example of characterization for Juror 3?

choices.answer: "Let's not be so sensitive..."
"They proved it a dozen diff. ways. You want me to list em?"
"I never saw a guiltier man in my life."
“We’re letting him slip through our fingershere!”

questions.question: Why does Reginald Rose characterize Juror 8 as curious, inquisitive, and fair?

choices.answer: To position him as the center of the conflict.
To clarify that he is the antagonist.
To demonstrate his friendship with Juror 9.
To justify casting Jack Lemmon to play him in the movie.

questions.question: How does Rose develop Juror 10’s character?

choices.answer: With contrasting couplets
With sharp diction and imagery
With racistquips and argumentative outbursts
With heated intellectual discussions

questions.question: Which moment is the turning point of the screenplay?

choices.answer: When Juror 8 stabs a knife into the table.
When 7 changes his vote “because I don’t think he’s guilty.”
When Juror 3 pretends to stab 8 saying, "Nobody's hurt."
When Juror 8 goes walking around the room like an old man.
Determined
Racist
Peaceful
Aggressive
"All right. Say ten seconds. What are you getting at?"
"You don't have to ask me. You know my answer. He lied."
"Take a look at that knife. It's a very strange knife."
"...slums are breeding grounds for criminals."

questions.question: Which is NOT a theme of "12 Angry Men"?

choices.answer: Justice
Murder
Reasonable Doubt
Bias

questions.question: Which quotation best supports the theme of "reasonable doubt"?

choices.answer: "The burden of proof is on the prosecution."
"Ran. Walked. What’s the difference? He got there."
"Why don’t they run the trial over so you can get it clear?"
"He said the boy yelled it out. That’s enough for me."

questions.question: Which statement best explains how characterization contributes to the theme of bias in 12AM?

choices.answer: Juror 3 is a terrible man with hatred for the boy on trial.
Jurors with attitudes decide a murder case.
Despite their prejudices, 12 jurors finally exonerate a boy.
The guard on duty is biased.

questions.question: Which quotation does NOT contribute to a theme of justice?

choices.answer: Everybody gets a fair trial.
I thought a man was entitled to unpopular opinions here.
Human life don't mean as much to them as it does to us.
You don't have the right to play like this with a man's life

questions.question: Why does Rose preface the text with "Think of 3+7=10"?

choices.answer: Because those are the most important characters
Because those jurors are secretly cousins
Because those jurors have obvious biases
Because he wants you to do the math

questions.question: What is the effect of Juror 3 finally changing his vote to not guilty?

choices.answer: It shows how sometimes justice isn't served
It shows how our jury system can work through the worst bias
It shows how the Corasanti trial connects to 12AM
It reminds the reader of Juror 3's son
